projects.name: NASA RMC Lunar Rover
projects.desc: Team lead and excavation subsystem engineer for the Stevens NASA Robotic Mining Competition team, wherein we competed with 50 other university teams to design and build a lunar rover to collect icy-rogolith from below the surface of the moon.

projects.name: Micro Mecanum Robot
projects.desc: A fully custom, 3D-printed mecanum wheel-based mobile robot build to experiment with computuer vision and autonomous robotics

projects.name: SMA-Based Origami Endoscope
projects.desc: During my internship at the UGA Medical Robotics Laboratory, I was part of the team that designed and manufactured an endoscope that utilized a low-cost origami inspired structure (D-CORE) and shape-memory-allow wire for actuation. The endoscope was designed for operation on a patient while inside an MRI machine. Our research was published in a number of peer-reviewed scentific journals. My roles included CAD Design & 3D printing of the D-CORE modules, building coltrol systems, and performing tests to quantify the performance of the mechanisms that we were prototyping.

projects.name: Combat Robotics (Robot Battles)
projects.desc: My entry into the 30lb (featherweight) combat robotics competition 'Robot Battles'. Fully cutsom designed in CAD, fabricated from 1/4-inch 6061 aluminum. I participated in a competition with many well-known bot builders in the BattleBots telivision series.

projects.name: DIY Electric Skateboard
projects.desc: My custom-built electric motor propelled longboard. The current iteration consists of a 12-cell lithium battery array and a large brushless DC motor, allowing for over 15 miles of range, and top speeds of near 25 miles-per-hour.

projects.name: FIRST Tech Challenge Robotics Team
projects.desc: I was president of my highschool's FIRST tech challenge robotics team. While I was on the team, we placed first in the state and made it to the national competition twice. I consider this pivotal in growing my passion toward mechanical engineerint, programming and robotics, and sparked a life-long interest.

projects.name: Light-Sensing Autonomous Robot
projects.desc: 3D Printed Robot designed for my ME Robotics Design class. It used bumpers and light sensors to navigate a maze-like course.

projects.name: Mecanum Ping-pong practice Robot
projects.desc: An assignment for my undergraduate design class was to design an intelligent ping-pong practice machine. While most of my peers designed simple ball launchers, I used my knowledge of mobile robots to design a self-contained, app-controlled intelligent ping pong robot.

projects.name: ME598 Intro to Robotics Final
projects.desc: My graduate-level Intro. to Robotics course, MATLAB control system for a moblile robot to autonomously sort colored pucks into colored squares.

projects.name: Arduino Weather Station
projects.desc: A custom desined, arduino controlled wifi-connected weather station capable of measuring wind speed, temperature, pressure and humidity, logging that data and serving that data over a webserver for datacollection from the devide while operating in the field.

projects.name: FlagQuest
projects.desc: A webapp created to help myself (and others) learn the country flags of the world. Written in ReactJS.

projects.name: RCServo Quadupedal Robot
projects.desc: 3D printed, servo driven quadrupedal robot. WIP

projects.name: Micro Mecanum Mk2
projects.desc: The second work-in-progress versoin of my Micro Mecanum Bot. Designd to accomadate a number of custom grippers and other attachments.

projects.name: Custom Robot PCB
projects.desc: A custom designd and manufactured PCB to simplify the wiring in my Micro Mecanum projects.

projects.name: Speaker Crossover Network
projects.desc: A speaker crossover circuit designed for my undergraduate circuits class.
